Part 4 Roost and nest sites The following map shows the locations where birds spend the night. IMPORTANT Roost = A bird temporarily spending a night at a location but moving frequently Potential nest = A bird returning to the same location through time (across multiple days and weeks) 4.0.1 Nighttime roost movement summary If a birds night-time roost is does not change then the average roost spacing will be very low (<0.5 km - green rows). We should also look at the data where the average roost spacing is <1km (orange rows). All other rows are white: name roost_spacing_km Frosty 0.2 Clifford 1.3 Messi 1.4 Elvis 3.4 Pilo 5.5 Forsyth 7.1 Pedro 7.3 Santa 7.3 Elizabeth 7.4 Robinhood 7.7 Fossey 8.0 Bonnie 8.1 Attenborough 11.7 Goodall 13.3 Jatayu 16.7 Wilson 16.7 Rocky 18.1 Kingkong 18.2 Carolina 18.3 Charizard 19.3 Moskovits 19.4 Ugalde 19.6 Wencelas 26.4 Kingdavid 26.9 You can see the distribution of the nightime locations with the following map. Where: the points mark the first and last observations from each day, and the lines connect those points. Animals which are nesting will have a very tight cluster of points.
